name: Dun Aoibhinn House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While it was probably the most minimalist of our hotels and BB's in our week in Ireland, it was all we needed really and the price was welcome after spending much more for average places.
reviews.title: Basic - Hostel/Pension type guest house.

reviews.text: Like I mentioned the rooms are basic - just beds in a room with a flatscreen on the wall and a shower. The breakfast was lacking, but being off-season we were warned not to expect much....serve yourself.
reviews.title: Needs renivated and cleaned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Owner was gracious and had a map available to get downtown and to the better eateries and pubs. Had a great time in Galway.
reviews.title: Needs a lot of work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't expect much here at this guesthouse, but it was easy to find and plenty of parking and close enough to downtown to grab a bite. Traffic in Galway can be a bear.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Hostel level is exactly what we thought of this B&B as mentioned in an earlier review. Carpeting is worn and dirty, dirt on wood floors and baseboards, bedspread looked dingy and old, bed looked lumpy, and power cords were strewn about in view. We decided to forego our deposit and stayed in a hotel nearer to Quay Street for the same price, cleaner, nicer and we were much happier.
reviews.title: Great value and location

description: Dun aoibhinn house is a beautifully restored period style residence in Galway city. It is located within 5minutes walk of the city centre and within 5 mins walk to the beach in Salthill, National university of Ireland(nuig)and university college hospital Galway(uchg)Dun aoibhinn house is an ideal base from which to enjoy the capital of the west and its beautiful surroundings,enjoy the wonderfull shopping on offer, go to the theatre, museum, relax and enjoy a meal in one of the citys fantastic restaurants,or visit any of the numerous city pubs.
